Sequence Information.Source: Sequence truncation, fish, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Peptide discovery: N-terminal truncation of residues 1-9 of pardaxin 4.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is highly similar (72.73%) toPardaxin 4. S: 29%.Activity: active against E.coli D21 (MIC >100 ug/ml), A.calcoaceticus Ac11 (MIC >100 uM), P.aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC >100 uM), S.typhirnuriunz LT2 (MIC >100 uM), B. megateriurn Bm11 (MIC 12.5 uM), M. luteus ATCC 9341 (MIC 100 uM), and B. subtilis ATCC 6051 (MIC 18 uM).SAR: the peptide lost activity against Gram- bacteria after N-terminal truncation.
Literature Information.Author: Oren Z, Shai Y.1996
Literature Information.Title: A class of highly potent antibacterial peptides derived from pardaxin, a pore-forming peptide isolated from Moses sole fish Pardachirus marmoratus.
